Class Query

    • Method Detail

      • queryAPI

        public org.jdom2.Document queryAPI(java.lang.String request,
                                   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Query the webAPI with respect to the given parameters and build an XML-document containing the response. The default format is JSON so to use this method, please make sure to include a parameter which specifies that the format should be XML. For JSON, use queryAPIForJSON. If the server is too busy to handle the request, the method will call the server again until a response is received. The method has a built-in mechanism which makes sure that the API call limit of 1 call per second is always satisfied.
        Parameters:
        request - The request-string
        parameters - A mapped representation of query parameters used when calling the API, eg. [format, xml] to make sure the response is in XML-format.
        Returns:
        A JDOM document containing the response

      • getSequenceOfMatches

        public void getSequenceOfMatches(org.jdom2.Document document,
                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters,
                                 boolean firstQuery)
        Recursively iterate through available matches and add them to a document. The server will usually return 100 results per query. The iteration is done by taking the last match id in the set of 100 returned matches and performing a new query with that match id as a start_at_match_id parameter (effectively returning the last match from the previous query and 99 new entries). Note that only a player's last 500 matches can be retrieved due to Valve constraints. Also note that a root element must be specified for the document before populating it with matches.
        Parameters:
        document - The document which the data is added to. Must contain a root element.
        parameters - The parameters to use in the search.
        firstQuery - Boolean specifying whether this is the first step in the iteration. If so, the first match entry is not deleted.

      • queryAPIForJSON

        public org.json.JSONObject queryAPIForJSON(java.lang.String request,
                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parameters)
        Query the API and return the response as a JSONObject.
        Parameters:
        request - The request to be used in the query.
        parameters - The parameters to be used in the query.
        Returns:
        A JSONObject containing the response.
